verbose_text: XREF_BIBR Heme-oxygenase-1 (Hsp32), thioredoxin (a class of small redox proteins), and thioredoxin reductase can be transcriptionally upregulated by Nrf2 as part of the electrophile counterattack, also called the phase 2 response; this is a cell surveillance strategy to counteract any damaging effects of oxidant and electrophile molecules.
evidence: thioredoxin reductase can be transcriptionally upregulated by Nrf2
